articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. investors were big buyers of equity funds in the seven days through Nov. 15, spurred by expectations that the Federal Reserve may pause its interest rate hikes in light of recent subdued U.S. inflation data.
articles.title: US equity funds draw heavy inflows on expectations for Fed pause

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Shares of Swedish auto maker Volvo Cars (VOLCARb.ST) fell 14% on Friday as its top owner, China's Geely (0175.HK), sold parts of its holdings at a deep discount to the previous day's closing price.
articles.title: Volvo Cars shares plunge to record lows as Geely cuts stake

articles.author: Andy Bruce
articles.description: British retail sales volumes fell unexpectedly in October as stretched consumers stayed at home, official data showed on Friday, in a new warning sign for the economy.
articles.title: UK retail sales slide again in October in new blow for economy

articles.author: Clare Jim, Davide Barbuscia, Karin Strohecker
articles.description: China's direct interventions to ease a cash crunch for crisis-hit property developers are a step in the right direction, but analysts say these actions must be complemented by stronger fiscal and monetary policies to shore up demand in the sector.
articles.title: China needs to pull 'multiple levers' for property turnaround, say analysts

articles.author: Joyce Lee
articles.description: South Korean prosecutors sought on Friday a five-year jail term for the boss of Samsung Electronics (005930.KS) Jay Y. Lee over charges of accounting fraud and stock price manipulation involving an $8 billion merger of Samsung affiliates in 2015.
articles.title: South Korea prosecutors seek jail for Samsung boss on fraud, stock manipulation charges

articles.author: Christoph Steitz, Ron Bousso
articles.description: BP (BP.L) is seeking partners for offshore wind projects in Japan and may invest in hydrogen technology companies to tackle inflation and equipment bottlenecks that have battered the renewables sector.
articles.title: BP seeks partnerships to navigate renewables storm

articles.author: Samuel Shen, Rae Wee
articles.description: Global companies are making a beeline for China's debt markets, issuing record amounts of yuan-denominated bonds and borrowing heavily from mainland banks, capitalising on rock-bottom yuan interest rates as funding costs elsewhere jump.
articles.title: Cheap yuan catapults China to second-biggest trade funding currency

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Ari Rabinovitch
articles.description: Israeli soldiers found a tunnel shaft used by Hamas militants at Gaza's Al Shifa hospital, the army said, while the U.N. voiced concern no aid would be delivered to Palestinians on Friday via the Rafah crossing with Egypt.
articles.title: Hamas tunnel found at Gaza's Al Shifa hospital, says Israel; UN aid halted

articles.author: Jeff Mason
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden concludes a four-day diplomatic push with China as well as other Pacific nations on Friday in a final meeting with world leaders and a visit with Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador.
articles.title: Biden to wrap up four-day diplomatic summit by meeting Mexican president

articles.author: Donny Kwok, Casey Hall
articles.description: Alibaba Group's (9988.HK) Hong Kong shares slumped 10% on Friday after it scrapped plans to spin off its cloud business, citing uncertainties fuelled by U.S. curbs on exports to China of semiconductors used in artificial intelligence applications.
articles.title: Alibaba's U-turn on cloud unit spin-off lops $20 billion off its market value
